data.title: College Visit
data.text: This is a very popular breakfast place and you may need to wait a little while to get in, but the food is worth it and the service is outstanding.

data.title: Roots and blues fest
data.text: Went here on sunday line out the door, they don't take names, just wait in line. Very small place 7 booths and sitting at counter. Wait was 1 1/2 so we left. Went back Monday morning just a 15 minutes wait  there was 6 of us so had to sit at different booths. Food was good had scrabble eggs, bacon, Hash browns and a pancake. Small portions on eggs and hashbrowns. Someone had the "stretch" was good comes with chilie.  Comes in 3 sizes. Service was good. Very nostalgic place.

data.title: A Memorable Breakfast....
data.text: Stopped in with a group of four for breakfast at a little before 8 in the morning on a Wednesday.  We were preparing for a three day bike ride and were ready to fill up.  I enjoyed a dish called "The Stretch" which stacks eggs (cooked to order) on hash browns and covers them both with chili, cheese, peppers and onions.  I added a serving of corned beef hash which all in all made what I consider a fantastic breakfast.  Service was a bit hurried but all in all it was a memorable meal.

data.title: Not too good
data.text: Stopped for breakfast on our way thru Columbia.  We realized the good reviews might be because locals love the idea of the old diner that has been around forever.  Sorry all of you locals but the Broadway Diner is just not very good.  We had the loaded hashbrowns and the two egg breakfast with bacon and biscuits and gravy.  The bacon was pretty good.  The eggs were Ok.  The hashbrowns tasted too much like the old griddle they were cooked on.  Coffee was no where near as good as what we typically enjoy at home.

data.title: Best for very, very late night breakfast.
data.text: Many college students find out about this place because it is open after the bars close.  They have an item called the "stack" and you will not believe the size (and calories) included--due to bacon, hash browns gravy, eggs, etc.  You get the picture. They also have hamburgers and fries as well as most other diner breakfast and lunch items

data.title: Old business, tasty food
data.text: We love supporting small business owners so on our way through Columbia we ate breakfast at the Broadway Diner. Fun historic place close to campus, yummy food, small and oh if those walls could talk I'm sure there would be lots of stories. Ha! My husband had the Stretch - quite the conglomeration of food. Chili in the morning? Yes! I had the Breakfast in Bed - french toast with egg in the middle, topped with bacon jam. I ordered egg over medium and it came out cooked through. Disappointed, but it was good. It would have been excellent with a little run of the yolk.

data.title: Day of training
data.text: In Columbia for training in the conference before you get your day started you must go to Broadway Diner and have breakfast it is wonderful this is a must stop in Columbia great food

data.title: Neat little place
data.text:
Trying to avoid the chains as we travel, we stopped here. We enjoyed good sandwiches and quick service.
The desserts we tried were not to great. Cute atmosphere, very 1950's.

data.title: Cramped and kind of dirty
data.text: I realize that people love the nostalgia of the older restaurants, and for the most part I do also. It is a cool old place that brings the feeling of the diners from the 50's and earlier back to those that stop. I am thrilled to see that it is still in business and still thriving. That being said, I just did not enjoy being seated,along with my 2 elderly  handicapped parents, right next to the restrooms. We were always having to move, or scoot over to get out of the way of either the side entrance door or someone using the restroom. Our table was sticky and still had left over food from the last costumer on it. What we ate was below average. Even the coffee was cold. That was my first trip there, and to form an honest opinion I will go back to give it another try (without my parents).

data.title: Great food and atmosphere
data.text: The perfect diner experience. Great food, service, and atmosphere. Love the attention to details and making sure your order is exactly what you want.

data.title: My favorite diner ever!!!
data.text: Only make it to the Broadway once a year or so, but so freaking awesome!!! Had the Diner Eggs Benne. Go hungry. My wife always gets the Matts Dilemma, which she loves; chili for breakfast!! If you love diners, you have to visit the Broadway.

data.title: Best breakfast in Columbia
data.text: My wife and I eat here very often now and are extremely happy everytime we go. If you don't like a wait in the morning on the weekend don't go, it is a small diner. Well worth the wait though. The French toast is simple but done perfectly every time. Their burritos are amazing as well. Highly recommended.

data.title: Lunch with my daughter
data.text: Wow this is truly an American dining experience one of the forgotten things a mom and pop diner it's like walking back into the fifties the food is phenomenal I had a breakfast burrito my daughter had a burger what a wonderful place to come and eat and soak up the atmosphere it's one of the most neatest little 9 years I've ever seen in Columbia

data.title: The Stretch
data.text: We headed here on the recommendation of some family members who had been here just s couple weeks before. It's a small diner, with a big menu. Known for "The Stretch" which is a combination of hash browns topped with scrambled eggs, chili, cheddar cheese, green peppers and onions. I personally order it, but my husband did and he cleaned his plate.

data.title: Definitely a diner experience!
data.text: We just moved to CoMo and have heard about Broadway Diner a few times. I ended up there twice in about one week, once with my kids (ages 10 and 14) and once with new work acquaintances. It's a very small space, and I was there during the day on weekdays. I can only imagine what it's like on the weekends or late night with a college crowd. The location is great - in downtown, close to campus - and convenient to get to. It is a little dingy, definitely a well-loved space. The service is great and the food is, well, greasy diner food. It hit the spot, and I'm sure we'll find ourselves there from time to time when we have company but not sure it's a favorite of ours. The prices are very reasonable and the quantity of food makes it a good value. We felt a little sticky leaving there, but we were full and satisfied too.

data.title: Great for breakfast or late night eats!!! Can't go wrong!
data.text: Broadway Diner, affectionately call "Fran's" by my crew, offers great values on just about their whole menu. The omelets are top notch and generous. The Burgers are great. The 'Stretch' is old favorite from my college days. Nothing fancy, but certainly some of the best folks around offering good old fashioned food done very well.

data.title: fun place
data.text: Stopped in for breakfast one Sunday, had a short wait but ate at the counter.  Real 50's diner, formica and stainless stools.    Good, hearty omelets, hash browns, biscuits - the basics but all served up hot, tasty, with big servings.  Very friendly staff. A real gem!

data.title: A Hidden Gem
data.text: Met an individual from our company for breakfast.  He was a bit late, but the team of individuals in the diner kept me company and entertained.  They offered up some good suggestions and did not steer us wrong.  It was an amazing breakfast - filling and yummy.  They even make their own donuts!! But I was too full to try one.  Darling, friendly atmosphere and apparently a favorite of locals and the students from the university.  I would definitely return when down there on business again and certainly recommend it to anyone in the area!!  Great customer service!!

data.title: Delicious breakfast
data.text: My family really enjoyed their breakfast at this diner. It was small but very cozy and down home. The waitress was very friendly and patient with us! We sat at the counter which was fun for the children!

data.title: One of the best breakfasts in town
data.text: Very good food at any time of day.  But the breakfast is to die for and hashbrowns you will know you had something very good.
